intro: Dregea montana, commonly known as the mountain dregea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in spring. Dregea montana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid conditions.
